captions.text:
What's up fish tank people!
fishtanktv.com

Dustinsfishtanks
This is Steve. Bringing it to you from Steve's

house. look at my 72 bowfront. got species
Sunday today. we are going to talk about glossostigma.

we can just stand up and get a close up of
the glosso here at the bottom. this is one

of my favorite plants and one of my favorite
foreground plants. glossostigma has been a

long staple of the aquarium foreground plants.
it was originally brought in the industry

by the godfather himself, Takashi Amano. who
really brought aquascaping to a whole new

level. this is a great plant because he used
it for a lot of his aquascapes called iwagumi.

it is basically low foreground plant and really
no background plants what so ever. the glosso

I got here has been growing. its does require
some certain things to have success with.

I've failed it in the past and I think I know
why I did. the biggest thing I have going

for me on this particular tank is that I've
got great nutrients in the tank. Dustin taught

me a lot of things about fish tank a lot of
things about aquascaping over the years. and

one of the biggest things he taught me was
Go with the Dirt!. this tank is dirted. ever

since I went with dirted tanks I've had a
lot more success with my aquariums. there

is just a very thin layer of dirt covering
the entire bottom of this 72-gallon tank.

and on top of it is about an inch of what
I use is pool filter sand. it is cheap. I

buy a 50-pound bag for $10 at your local pool
store. makes for pretty good color. the other

thing you will have required for success with
glosso is CO2. I've got a large CO2 tank going

under here. its pumping down in here and I've
got a ladder. the ladder increases time with

surface area with the bubbles as they slowly
rise to the top. if you notice the bubbles

at the bottom are rather large and when we
get to the top they get pretty small. so that

means we are getting a lot of CO2 absorption
in my tank which really helps feed the glossostigma

a ton and helps you have success. last thing
that we don't really have shown here is that

I have 4 T5 lights on top of here. I use light
fixtures from zoomed. mostly because I like

them that they don't have little built in
fans that wind up breaking and causing noise.

they are purely heat cooled. I have 2 of the
T5 fixtures. they just came out with the new

fixture that's got 4 T5 bulbs. so zoomed a
shoutout I want free stuff so please send

them to me. lets talk more about glosso. what
you need for success. well unfortunately they

are a pain in the butt plant. you got to plant
lots of them. you got to plant them everywhere.

you got to individually plant every one of
those stems. they grow and they spread through

a ton. and if you look through right here
you can see how they spread. they spread with

these little runner chains. every one of these
runner chains if you cut these little 2 leaf

sections, you can see there are 2 little roots.
you can stick that in the ground with tweezers.

but you have to trip it pretty often and you
have to trim it a lot. so what I do, in order

to keep the tanks looking good. every 2 weeks
you want to trim the tallest of the plants.

you just cut them off here. Just trim. you're
going to get growth back from the bottom.

It's going to grow back over time. It's also
going to encourage it to spread over the surface

of the low part of the tank and it's going
to keep it from looking tall and mangled.

it does get there over time. so definitely
trim it. I think every 2 weeks is sufficient.

It's going to take a bit of commitment with
this plant. the other thing is that every

one of these you can plant back into the ground
in the sand so I got my little tweezer and

just grab it here at the bottom. and get this
in the back and we are done. that is it. so

you get to the point where you got your tank
full after a while but glosso is a great plant.

makes great foreground plants. looks really
good. its high maintenance. you need nutrients.

I prefer dirt. you need CO2. and you need
good lighting. that's the secret to species
Sunday Glossostigma. Thank you.

title: High Tech CO2 Aquarium Plant: Glosso Glossostigma Species Sunday
